item.title: Hyundai unveils Ioniq 9 and Hydrogen Initium at Los Angeles auto show
item.description: At the Los Angeles Auto Show, Hyundai unveiled its Ioniq 9, a large electric SUV set to launch in early 2025. The vehicle offers a spacious, lounge-like interior and advanced E-GMP architecture.

item.title: How software-defined vehicles are revolutionising commercial vehicles —and why you should care
item.description: For fleet operators, SDVs offer much more than the buzz of innovation. Think of reduced operational costs, improved efficiency, and even new revenue streams. However, making this a reality requires a practical, ROI-driven approach, especially in cost-sensitive regions like India. Over the next decade, SDVs are expected to transition from emerging technologies to standard practices, equipping the commercial vehicle industry with crucial digital connectivity and data-driven capabilities.

item.title: Entrepreneurs discuss future of mobility, EV innovation at Bengaluru Tech Summit
item.description: With electrification accelerating, Shan emphasised the need for "collective innovation" in building a robust infrastructure, including electrified buses and smart mobility solutions, while keeping a people-centric approach.

item.title: Rockwell Automation and Microsoft unite to accelerate industrial transformation
item.description: This shared vision will be showcased through several new releases, to be previewed this week as Microsoft joins Rockwell as an exhibiting sponsor at the Automation Fair, taking place from 18–21 November in Anaheim, California. The partnership uniquely combines Rockwell’s extensive expertise in industrial automation with Microsoft’s cloud and AI capabilities. This collaboration bridges the gap between traditional industrial practices and modern digital applications, creating integrated solutions designed to unlock the full potential of industrial data.

item.title: Tata Elxsi, DENSO and AAtek inaugurate robotics and automation innovation lab in Frankfurt
item.description: The lab, located at Tata Elxsi's Frankfurt office, will serve as a research and development hub. It will feature modular automation demonstrations and focus on accelerating product development and simplifying maintenance. This initiative aims to address the increasing global demand for automation solutions.

item.title: Continental to unveil innovative invisible biometrics sensing display at CES 2025
item.description: Continental will showcase a new display at CES 2025. The display uses cameras and lasers to monitor passenger health and safety. It can detect vital signs and even check if seatbelts are fastened correctly. This technology is hidden within the display and is invisible to the eye. Continental received a CES Innovation Award for this technology.

item.title: Stellantis unveils technology to support flexible EV production, delays Ram electric pickup
item.description: Trump carries out plans to unravel various incentives around EV production and sales. Trump's transition team is planning to kill the USD 7,500 consumer tax credit for electric-vehicle purchases as part of broader tax-reform legislation, two sources with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters last week.

item.title: Meet the Acharya brothers; they helped enable DVDs, now they are turning cars into computers
item.description: Margi created the first widely available Personal Computer Memory Card International Association (PCMCIA) card that enabled full DVD playback on laptops. It is a standard for peripheral cards used in laptops.

item.title: Trump to push self-driving vehicles in boost to Tesla
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump's transition team is prioritizing a federal framework for fully self-driving vehicles. This move would benefit Tesla CEO Elon Musk, as Tesla heavily invests in self-driving technology. While the Transportation Department can adjust regulations, Congress's action is needed for mass adoption. Potential policy leaders and a bipartisan legislative measure are under consideration.

item.title: India to shift to 'smartphone era' for cars embracing 5G, advanced AI in 2025: Report
item.description: Starting in 2025, passenger cars in India will be equipped with 5G M2M connectivity, on-device GenAI, and cloud connectivity, making advanced technologies accessible across various price segments, it added.

item.title: Allegro MicroSystems expands R&D facility in Hyderabad, boosting Telangana's semiconductor ecosystem
item.description: Allegro MicroSystems, a global leader in magnetic sensing and power IC solutions, is setting up an R&D facility in Hyderabad. The facility will create 500 jobs. It will focus on EV, automotive, and robotic automation. Telangana government is supporting the establishment. Allegro MicroSystems aims to contribute to India's semiconductor vision.

item.title: Foxconn sees robust AI server demand, delays EV target
item.description: The world's largest contract electronics maker has already been diversifying its supply chain, expanding production in India in particular. It said on Thursday it would continue to increase investment in countries including the United States, Mexico and Vietnam.

item.title: Demand for ADAS surges amid growing road safety concerns in India
item.description: The survey revealed a high prevalence of road accidents in India, with 54% of respondents reporting involvement in a traffic accident within the past two years. This alarming statistic underscores the need for immediate and long-term interventions to improve road safety.

item.title: Wipro and Forvia partner to enhance vehicle safety with ADAS
item.description: Forvia leveraged Wipro Engineering Edge's Cloud Car solution, specifically its Microservices and vehicle container architecture, to improve its ADAS applications. This implementation enables Forvia's ADAS applications to function independently of specific hardware, resulting in reduced maintenance expenses and seamless integration into Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEM) value chains through cloud-native architecture.

item.title: Volkswagen boosts bet on Rivian's EV tech by USD 800 million
item.description: The companies also named leaders for their multibillion-dollar joint venture and showcased a prototype EV. The spending may ease concerns about Rivian's cash burn and give the German carmaker access to its US partner's software technology - an area where VW has stumbled.

item.title: AI-powered semiconductors: Pioneering the future of the automotive industry
item.description: From improving vehicle efficiency to enabling real-time decision-making and intelligent transportation systems, advanced semiconductor technology is paving the way for a safer, smarter, and more efficient future of mobility.

item.title: Daegu hosts inaugural FIX Innovation Awards, honouring pioneers in mobility, robotics, and ABB technologies
item.description: Daegu Metropolitan City and EXCO honored 36 companies at the inaugural FIX Innovation Awards for their technologies in mobility, IT, and robotics. Awardees will receive support through accelerator programs, ESG consulting, and international networking opportunities.

item.title: Bosch Q2 revenue rises 6.4% to INR 4,394 crore on strong automotive sales
item.description: Bosch Limited witnessed revenue growth in the second quarter. The company's revenue reached INR 4,394 crores. Sales in passenger cars and off-highway segments drove this growth. The Power Solutions business, a major contributor, grew by 5.7%. Bosch Limited is optimistic about future growth, anticipating continued demand across segments.

item.title: Demand for ADAS surges amid growing road safety concerns in India
item.description: A new survey reveals that Indians are increasingly concerned about road safety. Many Indians have experienced road accidents in recent years. Two-wheeler riders are particularly vulnerable. The survey finds strong support for ADAS, but adoption remains low. Most respondents believe ADAS is crucial for safety and would consider purchasing ADAS-equipped vehicles.

item.title: Odisha startup launches fully autonomous logistics drone service
item.description: "Today's launch of Air Orca marks an important advancement for India's logistics sector and for us as an Odisha-based company", said Satyabrata Sathapathy, CEO of Bon V Aero said on Saturday.
